C++ Sensor Placement

Placing Sensors. More...


Modules

 C++ Argument Capturing
 These should only be used within any of DYNATRACE_AUTO_NODE_CAPTURE, DYNATRACE_AUTO_PUREPATH_CAPTURE.
 C++ Return Value Capturing
 C++ Exceptions

Defines

#define DYNATRACE_AUTO_NODE()   __DYNATRACE_AUTO__(0)
 Places a sensor.
#define DYNATRACE_AUTO_NODE_CAPTURE(code)   __DYNATRACE_AUTO_CAPTURE__(0, code)
 Places a sensor enabling argument capturing.
#define DYNATRACE_AUTO_PUREPATH()   __DYNATRACE_AUTO__(1)
 Places a sensor and marks it as entry point.
#define DYNATRACE_AUTO_PUREPATH_CAPTURE(code)   __DYNATRACE_AUTO_CAPTURE__(1, code)
 Places a sensor enabling argument capturing and marks it as entry point.

Detailed Description

Placing Sensors.

Remarks:
This is merely an alternative to Sensor Placement. Macros from there may still be used in combination with these.
void Foo::bar(int i, const char *cp, double d, boolean b) {
    DYNATRACE_API("BARAPI");
    DYNATRACE_AUTO_PUREPATH_CAPTURE(DYNATRACE_CAPTURE << i << cp << d << b);
    ...
}

int Foo::add(int a, int b) {
    DYNATRACE_AUTO_NODE_CAPTURE(DYNATRACE_CAPTURE << a << b);
    DYNATRACE_RETURN_INT32(a+b);
}

Define Documentation

 
#define DYNATRACE_AUTO_NODE (  )     __DYNATRACE_AUTO__(0)

Places a sensor.

See also:
DYNATRACE_AUTO_PUREPATH for marking this as entry point.

#define DYNATRACE_AUTO_NODE_CAPTURE ( code   )     __DYNATRACE_AUTO_CAPTURE__(0, code)

Places a sensor enabling argument capturing.

See also:
C++ Argument Capturing

DYNATRACE_AUTO_PUREPATH_CAPTURE for marking this as entry point.

 
#define DYNATRACE_AUTO_PUREPATH (  )     __DYNATRACE_AUTO__(1)

Places a sensor and marks it as entry point.

See also:
DYNATRACE_AUTO_NODE for placing a sensor and NOT marking this as entry point.

#define DYNATRACE_AUTO_PUREPATH_CAPTURE ( code   )     __DYNATRACE_AUTO_CAPTURE__(1, code)

Places a sensor enabling argument capturing and marks it as entry point.

See also:
C++ Argument Capturing

DYNATRACE_AUTO_NODE_CAPTURE for placing a sensor and NOT marking this as entry point.
